intro: Callicarpa kwangtungensis var. trichocarpa, commonly known as the Chinese beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its vibrant purple to red berries that appear in late summer to early autumn. The plant has opposite, simple, ovate to elliptic leaves with serrated margins. It typically grows to a height of 2–4 meters and thrives in partial shade to full sun. The berries are not only ornamental but also attract birds and other wildlife.
